content: skull motifs all the little details yarn peaches & cream cotton worsted white crochet hook f-5/3 75 mm or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle 1 stitch marker finished measurements width 3 ¾ inches length 5 inches gauge the pattern gauge is not important for this project skill level step 1 chain 14 slip_stitch in beg chain to form loop confident beginner step 2 chain 14 again slip_stitch in 14th chain from hook to form another loop now you should have 2 loops that look like stitches & notes the number 8 or a pair of glasses step 3 work 18 single_crochet evenly around the first loop then work 18 single_crochet evenly around the second loop stitches  slip_stitch slip_stitch tip using the yarn tail left at the end of the  chain chain starting chain wrap it snugly around the  single_crochet single_crochet space between the eyes 3 or 4 times  triple crochet treble_crochet secure the end by pulling it through the  invisible join optional loop you make while wrapping this gives your skull a nice finished look original interpretation by robin brzozowski for crochet nirvana  inspiration for pattern from post www crochetnirvana weebly now you ll be working in row to create the top of the skull above the eyes the forehead set up row slip_stitch in the next 7 sts this will get you from between the eyes to the top edge so you can start working in row row 1 chain 1 turn 14 single_crochet across top of eyes row 2 turn don t chain 1 skip 1st single_crochet 12 single_crochet across leave last single_crochet unworked row 3 turn don t chain 1 skip 1st single_crochet 10 single_crochet across leave last single_crochet unworked row 4 turn don t chain 1 skip 1st single_crochet 8 single_crochet across leave last single_crochet unworked row 5 turn don t chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet across 8 single_crochet stop here and use stitch marker to hold your place cut yarn leaving about 36 48 inches after finishing the lower portion of the skull you re going to come back to the marker and use the extra long yarn tail to create the border around the skull you can fasten_off after row 5 and the reattach the yarn for the border but if you do it this way there are fewer knots and tails to weave in bottom of the skull the nose and teeth turn the skull upside down find the center under the eyes count 7 stitches right and join the yarn in that stitch row 1 single_crochet in same st as join and in next 3 single_crochet chain 4 skip 6 stitches single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet 8sc ch4 space row 2 chain 1 turn 4sc 4sc in chain 4 space 4 single_crochet 12 single_crochet row 3
